Quiz.question:
1 Part III: Interpreting the Findings Select the correct option, and click the Submit button. What is the overall risk to the worker for a 1-hour exposure? Based on the following information, answer each question regarding the risk to a worker for a 1-hour exposure:
  • The estimated concentration of Methylene Chloride is between 7-22 ppm
  • The tasks in the maintenance shop are performed with no hazard controls.
  • You can assume a medium confidence in characterization.
    • You have 1 question left. Low Medium High Extremely High 2
